title: Antti Mäkijärvi
text:
Antti Mäkijärvi (born 8 December 1993) is a <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> who plays for <a href="Ykk%C3%B6nen">Ykkönen</a> side <a href="Kotkan%20Ty%C3%B6v%C3%A4en%20Palloilijat">KTP</a>. Previously, he played in <a href="Germany">German</a> <a href="Regionalliga%20Nord">Regionalliga Nord</a> side <a href="VfB%20Oldenburg">VfB Oldenburg</a>. Mäkijärvi was born in <a href="Espoo">Espoo</a>, <a href="Finland">Finland</a>. He began his senior club <a href="career">career</a> playing for <a href="Pallohonka">Pallohonka</a>, before making his league debut for Honka at age 17 in 2011. After winning his first trophy, the <a href="Finnish%20League%20Cup">Finnish League Cup</a>, during his first season on league level, he helped Honka win the 2012 <a href="Finnish%20Cup">Cup</a>.
Club career.
Honka.
Mäkijärvi started his <a href="Veikkausliiga">Veikkausliiga</a> career in local team <a href="FC%20Honka">FC Honka</a> in 2011.
Ilves.
On 14 April 2015, Mäkijärvi signed for <a href="FC%20Ilves">FC Ilves</a> on a one-year contract.
Oldenburg.
On 10 August 2015 it was announced that Mäkijärvi had signed a contract with VfB Oldenburg.
Return to Honka.
On 1 April 2018, Mäkijärvi signed a 1+1 year contract with Honka.
International career.
Mäkijärvi has 40 caps for Finland national youth teams. He made his debut in the <a href="UEFA%20European%20Under-21%20Championship">UEFA European Under-21 Championship</a> qualifications in <a href="Raatti%20Stadium">Raatti Stadium</a>, <a href="Oulu">Oulu</a> on 11 June 2013 in a match against <a href="Lithuania%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Lithuania</a>.
